str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To store up, treasure up, save, lay up. From thesauros; to amass or reserve.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From teros; to guard, i.e. To note; by implication, to detain; by extension, to withhold; by extension, to withhold.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Decision; by extension, a tribunal; by implication, justice.
Destruction, ruin, loss, perishing; eternal ruin. From a presumed derivative of apollumi; ruin or loss.
Impious, ungodly, wicked. Irreverent, i.e. impious or wicked.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
